item.title: Baywatch Dolphin Tour
item.description: This Galveston Baywatch Dolphin Tour is a great way to see dolphins on the water in just a few hours. Meet your group and captain at Pier 21 and join the boat you’re assigned for this experience. Then, take off on the water to enjoy some time searching for dolphins in their natural habitat.

image.alt: Baywatch Dolphin Tour

item.title: Historic Galveston Ghost Tour
item.description: Discover the darker side of Galveston on a ghost tour. Pass by mansions and other historical sights where spooky and mysterious things are said to have happened, and hear about the island's secrets, paranormal events, and haunted history that dates back 150 years. This tour is a fun way to learn a bit about Galveston's history.

image.alt: Historic Galveston Ghost Tour

item.title: Walk with the Dead: Galveston Old City Cemetery Tour
item.description: Take an exciting journey into the unknown during this captivating 1.5-hour tour of Galveston Old City Cemetery. Venture to a place where apparitions have been said to appear and paranormal activity has been reported all while being securely lead by the hands of experienced guides. Join for what promises to be a unique experience—one only made possible by thorough academic research and brave exploration.

image.alt: Walk with the Dead: Galveston Old City Cemetery Tour

item.title: Galveston Red Light District Tour
item.description: Discover Galveston’s sordid past during an evening walking tour of the city’s Red Light District. Join a small group and your guide to walk the streets and listen to stories of mobsters, bootleggers, and brothels. Learn how the island was once a “sin city,” where men could come to drink, gamble, and look for love once they crossed into the mob-run “Free State of Galveston.”

image.alt: Galveston Red Light District Tour

item.title: Galveston's Haunted Cemetery Walking Tour
item.description: Take a walk down memory lane and through Galveston's eerie cemeteries during this nighttime walking tour. Spend the evening visiting several graveyards including Old City, Broadway, Evergreen, and the Yellow Fever yard to hear stories of past Galveston residents. Learn about the symbolism of the cemeteries, the yellow fever plague, the Great Storm, and the paranormal activity in the city.

image.alt: Galveston's Haunted Cemetery Walking Tour

item.title: Ghost On the Strand Ghost Tour
item.description: Uncover the sordid past of Galveston, Texas on a spooky walking tour along the Strand. Follow your guide as they point out several locations that are known for eerie paranormal activity. Galveston has seen a lot of devastation over the years—hurricanes, pandemics, wars, fires, and pirates—and has become a haven for ghosts.

image.alt: Ghost On the Strand Ghost Tour

item.title: Al's Ghost tour : a small group experience
item.description: Get up close and personal to Galveston’s sordid past on this small-group walking tour. Come in close contact with paranormal activity as you tour Old Galveston. Your guide provides first-hand accounts of paranormal activity that’s been experienced in this haunted town, once known for bootleggers and brothels. Get ready to be spooked and capture your experience on camera.

image.alt: Al's Ghost tour : a small group experience

item.title: Galveston Haunted Pub Crawl Walking Tour
item.description: Discover the sordid history of Galveston while enjoying drinks in the city’s haunted bars and restaurants on this pub crawl. Meet your guide and group in the city center and hear stories about ghosts, murderers, and paranormal activity. Stop at the Railroad Museum, Saengerfest Park, Hendley Market, and much more throughout the night. Drinks are at your own expense.

image.alt: Galveston Haunted Pub Crawl Walking Tour

item.title: Storm on the Strand Ghost Tour
item.description: Uncover the sordid past of Galveston as you walk through the historic Strand district during this nighttime ghost tour. Listen to spooky stories of sudden deaths and paranormal sightings as you explore important landmarks like the Railroad Museum, Tremont House, and the Grand 1894 Opera House. The city is just waiting to show you its eerie past.

image.alt: Storm on the Strand Ghost Tour

item.title: The Shadows of Revelry Walking Ghost Tour
item.description: Discover the ghostly history of Galveston, Texas on a nighttime walking tour around town. This adults–only tour takes a look at the city’s red–light district and its history as a place for gambling and drinking. Walk past old brothels, learn about outlaws and pirates, and hunt for ghosts as you explore.

image.alt: The Shadows of Revelry Walking Ghost Tour

item.title: Historical Tour of Galveston by Air-Conditioned Bus
item.description: This Galveston Historical Bus Tour is a great pick for any traveler (or local) who’s short on time but still wants to hear about the city’s history, particularly the storm of 1900. Hop aboard the bus and pass by key landmarks, such as the Galveston Railroad Museum, as your guide shares fun historical stories. This Galveston tour has a short duration time, which makes it easy to fit into any busy schedule.

image.alt: Historical Tour of Galveston by Air-Conditioned Bus

item.title: Spooky Strand Ghost Tour
item.description: Enjoy an offbeat introduction to the spooky side of Galveston that few travelers get to experience during this private ghost walking tour of The Strand, ideal for travelers on a time budget. Gain an insight into the multitude buildings alone The Strand, learning tales of ghosts, pirates, and civil war soldiers that you wouldn’t uncover alone.

image.alt: Spooky Strand Ghost Tour

item.title: The Ghosts of Galveston Guided Walking Tour
item.description: Galveston, Texas is currently known as a place to go and relax, but the city has endured a lot over the years. From the Civil War to Yellow Fever to the Great Hurricane of 1900, a lot of lives were lost in this coastal village. Discover the city’s historic and haunted streets on a small–group, nighttime walking tour and get a closer look at Galveston’s eerie past.

image.alt: The Ghosts of Galveston Guided Walking Tour

item.title: Replica 1908 Model-T Electric Golf Cart Rental
item.description: Tour around Galveston in style, on a replica of a 1908 Model-T electric golf cart with the famous ahooga horn. You can choose a 5 or 8 seater for this self-guided tour, where you can spend as much time as you like. You can see Pleasure Pier, the historic district, the Kemp Ridley Sea Sculptures, and more. It’s up to you.

image.alt: Replica 1908 Model-T Electric Golf Cart Rental

item.title: The Bryan Museum Admission
item.description: Discover the Wild West history of Galveston, Texas with this admission ticket to The Bryan Museum. Enjoy a self-guided tour through the rich collection of artifacts dating back more than 12,000 years. Learn about several topics including the first settlers—the Native Americans—the annexation of Texas from Mexico, and the Civil War era, as you explore the museum.

image.alt: The Bryan Museum Admission

item.title: Galveston Island Ghost Tour
item.description: Galveston's history is filled with dark and gruesome moments. Uncover the city's haunted past as you walk around town with a small group and tour guide. Stop at historic mansions and buildings that are known for paranormal activity and keep your eyes peeled for any otherworldly guests that might make an appearance.

image.alt: Galveston Island Ghost Tour

item.title: Galveston Mansions and Murder Walking Tour
item.description: Galveston is full of awesome old mansions, but if you don’t know where to look for them, you could pass them by without noticing. Take this Galveston Mansions and Murder Walking Tour and see sights such as Moody Mansion while you hear about the creepy history of the city from your guide. Plus, a walking tour keeps you active as you trek on foot at a comfortable pace.

image.alt: Galveston Mansions and Murder Walking Tour

item.title: Juneteenth and Beyond African American Guided History Tours
item.description: If you’re looking to dive into the Black history of Galveston, but don’t want to plan your own explorations, book this Galveston Juneteenth and Beyond Small-Group Cultural Tour. A guide who knows the city well leads the way to historic and cultural sites as you take in stories and information they share with you. Plus, this tour can easily be fit into any busy day, with morning and afternoon tour times offered.

image.alt: Juneteenth and Beyond African American Guided History Tours

item.title: Sand Castle Lesson
item.description: Building sandcastles might seem like child’s play but there are several tips and tricks to creating grandiose sand sculptures. Grab your friends and family, head to the beach of your choice in Galveston, and meet with a sandcastle professional. Learn several methods of turning sand into works of art and enjoy a fun day on the beach.

image.alt: Sand Castle Lesson

item.title: Half-Day Jetty Fishing Trip from Galveston
item.description: Go fishing in Galveston, Texas with a private half-day fishing charter. Climb aboard a boat for a scenic cruise and fishing excursion in the Gulf of Mexico, with bait, fishing gear, and fuel all included. Sharpen your fishing skills and get advice from an experienced angler guide. Kids are welcome aboard for this family-friendly fishing adventure.

image.alt: Half-Day Jetty Fishing Trip from Galveston

item.title: Great! Galveston Ghost Tour
item.description: Listen to stories about murder, mayhem, and otherworldly encounters as you embark on a nighttime walking tour through Galveston. Join a small group and follow your guide through alleyways, past haunted mansions, and shadowy corners to reveal their dark secrets. Learn of past residents who can't seem to move on to the other side as you and keep your eyes peeled for paranormal sightings.

image.alt: Great! Galveston Ghost Tour

item.title: Galveston's Secrets of the Strand Walking Tour
item.description: Prebook this popular Galveston Secrets of the Strand District Walking Tour to guarantee your spot on the tour on the day you prefer to go. Dive into the district’s history with a guide who knows it well. See main attractions in the area such as the Galveston Railroad Museum, Tremont House, and Grand 1894 Opera House, as you learn how each played a big role in the city’s past.

image.alt: Galveston's Secrets of the Strand Walking Tour

item.title: Haunted Harbor Tour 90 Minute Boat Ride at Night Galveston
item.description: Explore Galveston's haunted past with our Haunted Harbor Tour, where you'll visit eerie sites like the USS Texas, the Tall Ship Elissa, and the Ghost Face of UTMB. Ideal for adventure seekers and families, this tour offers an immersive experience blending local legends with historical insights. Discover spine-chilling stories and insider knowledge about Galveston's haunted waters, making it a memorable outing for those eager to uncover the island's ghostly secrets. Perfect for anyone craving a thrilling cultural journey, this tour provides unique encounters with Galveston's eerie history that will leave you both intrigued and entertained.

image.alt: Haunted Harbor Tour 90 Minute Boat Ride at Night Galveston

item.title: Groovy Galveston Scavenger Hunt
item.description: Get to know Galveston on this scavenger hunt, with help from your remote interactive guide. This is a challenge and a detective hunt where you need to find and solve clues to get to the next hidden spot, learning about the history and culture of Galveston the whole time. You can also compete with other teams on the website’s leaderboard for extra fun.

image.alt: Groovy Galveston Scavenger Hunt
